channel.title: The first rule
channel.description:
Now I know the first rule of Fight Club, but I've gotta say, it's not as good as I expected.
I was expecting some movie similar to "Never Back Down" or "Warrior" but despite that, it was an ok movie. Have you guys watched it, whats your opinion?

item.title: The first rule
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“runeite51, post:7, topic:527196”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=645942.msg4348612#msg4348612 date=1376309854]

[quote author=Mikeyzzz link=topic=645942.msg4348570#msg4348570 date=1376291281]

Did you understand the movie?
[/quote]This overall. It won’t be good if you didn’t even understand the main plot or the meaning of the movie.
[/quote]Really, what I understood from it was, he is himself, but he created that second person, because he though he himself couldn’t do it, and had to have some sort of catalyst. close?

When I saw it, my interpretation was that he had dissociative identity disorder.

I thought it was schizophrenia, like a [spoiler]A Beautiful Mind[/spoiler] type movie.[/quote]

I can see that.

I just looked it up, he did in fact have DID/MPD.

Read full topic

[/quote]Really, what I understood from it was, he is himself, but he created that second person, because he though he himself couldn’t do it, and had to have some sort of catalyst. close?

When I saw it, my interpretation was that he had dissociative identity disorder.[/quote]

I thought it was schizophrenia, like a [spoiler]A Beautiful Mind[/spoiler] type movie.

item.title: The first rule
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:5, topic:527196”][quote author=Mikeyzzz link=topic=645942.msg4348570#msg4348570 date=1376291281]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=645942.msg4348516#msg4348516 date=1376282926]

Did you understand the movie?
[/quote]This overall. It won’t be good if you didn’t even understand the main plot or the meaning of the movie.
[/quote]Really, what I understood from it was, he is himself, but he created that second person, because he though he himself couldn’t do it, and had to have some sort of catalyst. close?

When I saw it, my interpretation was that he had dissociative identity disorder.[/quote]The movie starts out with him going to all these “help groups” with a new identity every time. When he takes the airplane he finally meets a fictional character Tyler Durden (with the main character’s name still unspoken). Basically Tyler (the main character, the real one) was tired of his life and noticed he couldn’t change it for himself, so he basically created an alternate ego to carry out his new life. So that the ‘new’ Tyler was just him the entire time. It’s a little more deep than that, it’s been a couple years since I saw it last but I was pretty mind-fucked when I realized what happened haha.

Read full topic
